intro: Sciaplea sciap-sciaple, commonly known as the candleplant, is a unique succulent native to South Africa. It features a thick, cylindrical stem that resembles a candle, often covered in a waxy, grayish coating. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the summer months. Its leaves are modified into spines, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Sciaplea sciap-sciaple is well adapted to dry conditions and is often used in rock gardens due to its striking appearance.
